Operation 'DeleteSingleSends' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_side_effects. Original description has a typo in the endpoint path (`singlensends` should be `singlesends`). More importantly, it lacks clarity about the input format (array structure), explicit mention of what constitutes the request body, and the response status code. Enhanced version clarifies input requirements, emphasizes irreversibility, and specifies the expected response for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete multiple Single Sends using an array of Single Sends IDs.**

To first retrieve all your Single Sends' IDs, you can make a GET request to the `/marketing/singlensends` endpoint.

Please note that a DELETE request is permanent, and your Single Sends will not be recoverable after deletion.
data.description_suggestion:
**This endpoint allows you to delete multiple Single Sends using an array of Single Send IDs.**

Accepts an array of Single Send IDs in the request body. This operation permanently deletes all specified Single Sends and is not reversible. Deleted Single Sends cannot be recovered. To retrieve Single Send IDs, use the GET `/marketing/singlesends` endpoint. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion.
data.reasoning: Original description has a typo in the endpoint path (`singlensends` should be `singlesends`). More importantly, it lacks clarity about the input format (array structure), explicit mention of what constitutes the request body, and the response status code. Enhanced version clarifies input requirements, emphasizes irreversibility, and specifies the expected response for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'DeleteSingleSend' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_side_effects. Original description contains a typo in the endpoint path (`singlensends` should be `singlesends`). It lacks clarity about the input format (path parameter), response status code, and explicit confirmation of the deletion action. Enhanced version clarifies the path parameter requirement, specifies the expected response, and emphasizes irreversibility for better AI agent decision-making about when to use this destructive operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete one Single Send using a Single Send ID.**

To first retrieve all your Single Sends' IDs, you can make a GET request to the `/marketing/singlensends` endpoint.

Please note that a `DELETE` request is permanent, and your Single Send will not be recoverable after deletion.
data.description_suggestion:
**This endpoint allows you to delete one Single Send using a Single Send ID.**

Permanently deletes the specified Single Send. This operation is irreversible and the deleted Single Send cannot be recovered. Requires the Single Send ID as a path parameter. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion. To retrieve Single Send IDs, use the GET `/marketing/singlesends` endpoint.
data.reasoning: Original description contains a typo in the endpoint path (`singlensends` should be `singlesends`). It lacks clarity about the input format (path parameter), response status code, and explicit confirmation of the deletion action. Enhanced version clarifies the path parameter requirement, specifies the expected response, and emphasizes irreversibility for better AI agent decision-making about when to use this destructive operation.

message: Operation 'DeleteScheduledSingleSend' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Current description lacks clarity about the return value and the resulting state of the Single Send after cancellation. The suggestion adds explicit information about the response status, the resulting state (draft status), and clarifies the distinction between canceling a schedule versus deleting the Single Send entirely. This improves AI agent interpretability regarding what happens after the operation completes.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to cancel a scheduled Single Send using a Single Send ID.**

Making a DELETE request to this endpoint will cancel the scheduled sending of a Single Send. The request will not delete the Single Send itself. Deleting a Single Send can be done by passing a DELETE request to `/marketing/singlesends/{id}`.
data.description_suggestion: Cancels the scheduled delivery of a Single Send by its ID. This operation removes the send schedule but does not delete the Single Send itselfthe Single Send remains in draft status and can be rescheduled. Returns a 200 status on successful cancellation. To permanently delete a Single Send, use the DELETE /marketing/singlesends/{id} endpoint instead.
data.reasoning: Current description lacks clarity about the return value and the resulting state of the Single Send after cancellation. The suggestion adds explicit information about the response status, the resulting state (draft status), and clarifies the distinction between canceling a schedule versus deleting the Single Send entirely. This improves AI agent interpretability regarding what happens after the operation completes.

message: Operation 'ListCategory' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Get All Categories' is too generic and lacks domain context. The suggestion specifies 'Single Send categories' for clarity. Description lacks detail about the response structure and the purpose of categories. The improved version clarifies the return limit, explains what categories are used for, and confirms authentication requirements, making it more useful for AI agents determining appropriate usage.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve all the categories associated with your Single Sends.**

This endpoint will return your latest 1,000 categories.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all categories associated with your Single Sends. Returns up to 1,000 categories in the response. Categories are used to organize and filter Single Sends. No authentication parameters are required beyond the standard API key.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get All Categories' is too generic and lacks domain context. The suggestion specifies 'Single Send categories' for clarity. Description lacks detail about the response structure and the purpose of categories. The improved version clarifies the return limit, explains what categories are used for, and confirms authentication requirements, making it more useful for AI agents determining appropriate usage.

message: Operation 'SearchSingleSend' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Get Single Sends Search' is awkward and unclearit doesn't indicate the action being performed. The suggestion uses clearer action-oriented language. Current description provides good examples but lacks clarity about the response format and how multiple criteria are combined (AND logic). The improved version clarifies the search parameter types, return value, and filtering behavior, enabling AI agents to better understand when and how to use this operation for campaign discovery and filtering.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to search for Single Sends based on specified criteria.**

You can search for Single Sends by passing a combination of values using the `name`, `status`, and `categories` request body fields.

For example, if you want to search for all Single Sends that are "drafts" or "scheduled" and also associated with the category "shoes," your request body may look like the example below.

```javascript
{
  "status": [
    "draft",
    "scheduled"
  ],
  "categories": [
    "shoes"
  ],
}
```
data.description_suggestion: Searches for Single Sends matching specified criteria. Accepts search parameters via request body including `name` (string match), `status` (array of statuses like 'draft', 'scheduled'), and `categories` (array of category names). Returns a list of Single Sends matching all provided criteria. Supports filtering by multiple statuses and categories simultaneously. Useful for finding campaigns by name, status, or organizational category.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get Single Sends Search' is awkward and unclearit doesn't indicate the action being performed. The suggestion uses clearer action-oriented language.
